identity.name: BLURA HUB
identity.target_audience: Government Agencies, Law Enforcement, Security Analysts

colors.mode_strategy: Light Mode Default (Tactical Light) with Dark Mode Toggle (Command Dark)

risk_levels.high: bg-red-100 text-red-700 border-red-200 dark:bg-red-900/30 dark:text-red-400 dark:border-red-800
risk_levels.medium: bg-amber-100 text-amber-700 border-amber-200 dark:bg-amber-900/30 dark:text-amber-400 dark:border-amber-800
risk_levels.low: bg-emerald-100 text-emerald-700 border-emerald-200 dark:bg-emerald-900/30 dark:text-emerald-400 dark:border-emerald-800

cards.style: border border-border bg-card shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow duration-200

badges.base: inline-flex items-center rounded-full border px-2.5 py-0.5 text-xs font-semibold transition-colors focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-ring focus:ring-offset-2

icons.usage: Use Lucide for UI (AlertTriangle, Shield, Users, Activity). Use FontAwesome for Brands (FaXTwitter, FaYoutube).

universal_guidelines: Use 'Tactical Density': Avoid excessive whitespace found in marketing sites. This is a tool. Information density should be high but legible.
Status Indicators: Every list item in the feed MUST have a clear visual indicator of its risk level (Left border color or Badge).
No Gradients: Use flat, solid colors for reliability and clarity.
Data-Test-IDs: All interactive elements must have data-testid attributes (e.g., 'login-btn', 'alert-card-1').
Empty States: Never leave a blank screen. Use an icon + text for 'No Alerts Active' or 'No Sources Configured'.
Loading States: Use skeleton loaders that match the table/card layout exactly.
Error Handling: Use Sonner toasts for transient errors, and inline alerts for persistent configuration errors.
instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Install 'lucide-react', 'react-icons', 'recharts', 'clsx', 'tailwind-merge' if not present. 2. Update 'tailwind.config.js' with the colors provided in this JSON. 3. Create a 'Layout' component that handles the Sidebar and Topbar structure. 4. Use the 'IBM Plex Sans' font for body and 'Chivo' for headings. 5. Implement the Dashboard using the 'Control Room Grid' philosophy (dense, actionable).
